unnormalised: A recent report from the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare indicates a surge in dengue cases across several states. As of 16/08/2024, over 10,000 cases have been reported nationwide, with Maharashtra, Kerala, and Delhi being the worst affected. Experts attribute the rise to early monsoon and inadequate vector control measures.
normalised: A recent report from the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare indicates a surge in dengue cases across several states. As of sixteenth august two thousand and twenty four, over ten thousand cases have been reported nationwide, with Maharashtra, Kerala, and Delhi being the worst affected. Experts attribute the rise to early monsoon and inadequate vector control measures.

unnormalised: Dr. VK Paul, a member of NITI Aayog, urges citizens to take preventive measures, including eliminating stagnant water sources and using mosquito repellents. Municipal corporations are being directed to intensify fogging operations in high-risk areas. The ministry has allocated Rs. 50 crore to support affected states in managing the outbreak.
normalised: Doctor V-K Paul, a member of N-I-T-I Aayog, urges citizens to take preventive measures, including eliminating stagnant water sources and using mosquito repellents. Municipal corporations are being directed to intensify fogging operations in high-risk areas. The ministry has allocated rupee fifty crore to support affected states in managing the outbreak.

unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi has reported a 20% increase in admissions related to dengue fever compared to the same period last year. Health officials are emphasizing early diagnosis and treatment to prevent complications. Guidelines issued by ICMR recommend Paracetamol 500mg for fever management and advise against the use of NSAIDs.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi has reported a twenty percent increase in admissions related to dengue fever compared to the same period last year. Health officials are emphasizing early diagnosis and treatment to prevent complications. Guidelines issued by I-C-M-R recommend Paracetamol five hundred milligram for fever management and advise against the use of N-S-A-I-D-S.

unnormalised: The health ministry plans to launch a nationwide awareness campaign starting 01/09/2024 to educate the public about dengue prevention and control. The campaign will utilize various media platforms, including TV, radio, and social media, to reach a wider audience and promote community participation in combating the spread of the disease.
normalised: The health ministry plans to launch a nationwide awareness campaign starting first september two thousand and twenty four to educate the public about dengue prevention and control. The campaign will utilize various media platforms, including T-V, radio, and social media, to reach a wider audience and promote community participation in combating the spread of the disease.
